pull.title: Document assumptions that are being made to avoid division by zero
pull.body:
Document assumptions (via `assert(…)`:s) that are being made to avoid division by zero.

Rationale:
* Make it clear to human reviewers and non-human static analyzers that what might look like potential division by zero cases are written the way they are intentionally (these cases are currently flagged by various static analyzers).

rename.from: Document assumptions that must be fulfilled to avoid division by zero
rename.to: Document assumptions that are being made to avoid division by zero

events.body: Hmm does adding that text change the behavior of the static analyzers? Otherwise it seems pretty human readable to me already, they aren't exactly complicated asserts :)

issue.title: Document assumptions that are being made to avoid NULL pointer dereferences
issue.body:
Document assumptions (via `assert(…)`:s) that are being made avoid `NULL` pointer dereferences.

Rationale:
* Make it clear to human reviewers and non-human static analyzers that what might look like potential `NULL` pointer dereferences are written the way they are intentionally (these cases are currently flagged by various static analyzers).

events.body:
utACK for asserting `!= 0` where added.
Agree with @MeshCollider that the extra text is redundant.

events.message: Document assumptions that are being made to avoid division by zero

events.body: @MeshCollider @sipa @danra Thanks for reviewing! Redundant comments removed. Looks good? :-)

issue.title: Codeai fixes: remove dead code, prevent possible division by zero.
issue.body:
CodeAi suggests the removal of 4 lines of dead code in log_reader.cc and pubkey.cpp.

CodeAi suggests inserting a check for `scale` to prevent possible division by zero in fees.cpp.

issue.title: Assertion fail when opening coin control dialog
issue.body:
### Describe the issue

### Can you reliably reproduce the issue?
#### If so, please list the steps to reproduce below:
1. Enable coin control features in Settings
2. Click Inputs... on Send tab

### Expected behaviour
Coin inputs dialog apears

### Actual behaviour
Crash with message

`bitcoin-qt: qt/coincontroldialog.cpp:585: static void CoinControlDialog::updateLabels(WalletModel*, QDialog*): Assertion `nBytes != 0' failed.`

### What version of bitcoin-core are you using?

master. 6ab0e4cf49549640b903bf5fce0e6035b8116397 or a865b38bf33202b66ee2e72912fe164aa2a504c7

### Any extra information that might be useful in the debugging process.

Reverting to 892809309c1bc370677241a715e57a2744f94323 fixes the problem

issue.title: Fix crash via division by zero assertion
issue.body:
Replaces the newly added `assert` for a devision by zero protection by a control structure. Floating point division by zero is defined by the floating point standard and results in +inf or -inf.

Introduced in #11133
Reported by @mzhou, fixes #11501
